page.title: 05MIDDLE LIPWOOD,HAYDON BRIDGE
page.content: The oldest part of the house was a medieval{Bastle,}a fortified house. Some of the walls are seven feet thick. It is a{listed building}which means that it cannot be altered without permission from the Department of the Environment. The other reason for its preservation is that it has {gin_gang,}a round,stone building once used for grinding corn. There are two wells, but spring water is now used. The farm_house served a tenanted farm until 1967 when Mr.& Mrs. Chapman bought it. They own a wholesale vegetable firm in Newcastle and used the house as a country cottage, but now they live there permanently. They enjoy taking{bed and breakfast} visitors especially those from Norway, the U.S.A, Holland & Germany. The house still has old "privies" but there are modern toilets & septic tank
